item.title: 任天堂在四天内售出 350 万台 Switch 2 游戏机，创历史新高
item.description: 任天堂公司在短短四天内就售出了 350 多万台 Switch 2，创下了该公司八年来首款新游戏机的销售记录。【原文：Nintendo Co. sold 3.5 million-plus units of the Switch 2 in just four days, a record-breaking start for the company’s first new console in eight years.】

item.title: 台湾限制拥挤金融业的敌意收购
item.description: 台湾监管机构宣布计划有效阻止岛内拥挤的金融业中的恶意收购，几个月前，该计划阻止了一项价值约 41 亿美元的交易，该交易本可创建台湾最大的金融集团。【原文：Taiwan regulators announced plans to effectively block hostile takeovers in the island’s crowded financial sector, months after preventing a roughly $4.1 billion deal that would have created Taiwan’s largest financial group.】

item.title: 中美贸易紧张局势缓和，中国股市上涨
item.description: 全球最大的两个经济体在伦敦举行为期两天的会议后，同意缓和贸易紧张局势，中国股市周三上涨。【原文：Chinese stocks rose on Wednesday, after the world’s two largest economies agreed to de-escalate trade tensions following a two-day meeting in London.】

item.title: 穆迪下调华纳兄弟分拆计划后的债券评级
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）下调了华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros Discovery Inc.【原文：Moody’s Ratings has downgraded debt issued by units of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., adding another complication to the media giant’s discussions with bondholders after it announced plans to split in two.】

item.title: 战神为亚洲特殊情况基金寻求 20 多亿美元投资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Ares Management Corp. 正在募集另一支亚洲特殊情况基金，以加强其在该地区的信贷投资。【原文：Ares Management Corp. is raising another Asia special situations fund to bolster its credit investments in the region, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 价格暴跌后，中国敦促养猪户限制供应
item.description: 中国正在努力控制生猪数量，抑制猪肉生产，以支撑中国最受欢迎的肉类价格，缓解经济通货紧缩压力。【原文：China is seeking to control hog numbers and curb pork production, in a bid to support prices of the country’s favorite meat and ease deflationary pressures in the economy.】

item.title: 台湾寿险公司 7000 亿美元押注美国，结果适得其反
item.description: 几十年来，台湾的人寿保险公司因大量投资美国债券而获得了高于平均水平的回报。现在，这种依赖已成为威胁 7000 多亿美元资产的主要风险。【原文：For decades, Taiwan’s life insurance companies boasted of above-average returns from their heavy investment in US bonds. That reliance is now a major risk threatening more than $700 billion of assets.】

item.title: 亚洲市场等待中美贸易谈判进展的更多细节
item.description: 亚洲的交易商大多回避了中美达成初步贸易协议的消息，大多数交易商在制定投资计划前都在寻求协议的更多细节。【原文：Asia’s traders mostly shrugged off news of a preliminary US-China trade deal, with most looking for more details from the accord before making investment plans.】

item.title: 印度国营炼油厂计划订购油轮供国内使用
item.description: 印度国营炼油企业正计划订购 10 艘国产船舶，用于在全国各地运输燃料，因为印度政府正在推进其扩大造船业的雄心壮志。【原文：India’s state-run refiners are planning to order 10 domestically-built vessels to transport fuels around the country as the government pushes ahead with its ambition to expand the shipbuilding industry.】

item.title: 即使中美同意缓和贸易战，黄金仍在走高
item.description: 美国和中国在伦敦会谈期间表示已就缓解贸易紧张局势的计划达成一致后，黄金仍然走高。【原文：Gold edged higher even after the US and China said they had agreed on a plan to ease trade tensions during talks in London.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利澳大利亚首席执行官称 IPO 和交易正在回归
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）澳大利亚主管表示，在经历了 "可怕的 "上半年之后，他看到首次公开募股和兼并活动正在恢复，因为澳大利亚的稳定吸引了海外资本。【原文：Morgan Stanley’s Australia chief said he’s seeing a return of initial public offerings and merger activity after a “horrible” first half as the country’s stability draws overseas capital.】

item.title: 交易员解读中美贸易框架协议，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 石油价格变化不大，因为交易商们正在消化中美两国在伦敦会谈后就改善贸易关系达成的初步协议。【原文：Oil was little changed, as traders digested an initial agreement between the US and China to improve trade relations following talks in London.】

item.title: 新西兰央行称阿德里安-奥尔因对资金问题存在分歧而辞职
item.description: 新西兰央行称，前行长阿德里安-奥尔因政府削减该行资金而辞职。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank said former governor Adrian Orr resigned over government cuts to the bank’s funding.】

item.title: 克鲁兹称 "星链 "最适合乡村机场，不适合城市机场
item.description: 参议员特德-克鲁兹（Ted Cruz）说，城市机场应使用光纤通信，而埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Starlink 卫星服务可能更适合农村机场。【原文：Urban airports should use fiber-optic communications while Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite service may be better for rural ones, Senator Ted Cruz said.】

item.title: 亚洲私人银行家呼吁重新考虑 60/40 投资组合分配比例
item.description: 私人市场工具、黄金和人民币作为另类投资，对亚洲私人银行家的吸引力与日俱增，因为他们已经超越了传统的股票和债券配置。【原文：Private market instruments, gold and Chinese yuan are looking increasingly appealing as alternative investments to private bankers in Asia as they push beyond traditional stock and bond allocations.】

item.title: 随着部分关税转嫁，美国通胀有望回升
item.description: 预测人员称，5 月份美国的基本通胀率可能有所回升，这反映出关税转嫁对主要是进口商品的影响不大，而机票等一些服务的价格涨幅较小或直接下降。【原文：Forecasters say underlying US inflation likely picked up in May, reflecting a modest impact from tariff pass-through for goods that are mostly imported, while some services like airfares saw smaller price gains or outright declines.】

item.title: 太空公司 Voyager 首次公开募股融资 3.83 亿美元，定价高于发行区间
item.description: 航海家科技公司（Voyager Technologies Inc.【原文：Voyager Technologies Inc. raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering Tuesday, pricing its shares above a marketed range.】

item.title: 酱油生产商佛山海天开始接受高达 12 亿美元的香港 IPO 订单
item.description: 佛山海天调味食品股份有限公司开始接受投资者订单，准备在香港首次公开募股，募集资金可能高达 95.6 亿港元（12 亿美元），这是今年推动香港股票销售复苏的最新一家大型上市企业。【原文：Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food Co. began taking investor orders for a Hong Kong initial public offering that could raise as much as HK$9.56 billion ($1.2 billion), the latest big listing powering the city’s share-sale recovery this year.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因贸易谈判希望而追随美国股市涨势：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市将追随华尔街的涨势，因为投资者正在关注美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）所说的 "进展非常非常顺利 "的中美贸易谈判。【原文：Stocks in Asia are set to follow gains on Wall Street as investors monitor trade discussions between the US and China that Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said were “going really, really well.”】

item.title: 美国广播公司新闻频道因社交媒体上的文章撤换记者特里-莫兰
item.description: 沃尔特-迪斯尼公司（Walt Disney Co.【原文：Walt Disney Co.’s ABC News division said it parted ways with Washington-based correspondent Terry Moran over comments he made on social media about White House Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller.】

item.title: 全球银行争相在蓬勃发展的日本招聘顶尖人才
item.description:
在全球最紧张的劳动力市场之一，招聘人员将求职者困在房间里数小时，并通过派对来吸引他们。【原文：

In one of the world’s tightest labor markets, recruiters are cornering applicants in rooms for hours and wooing them with parties.

】

item.title: 华尔街从澳大利亚 2.7 万亿美元养老金中获益更多
item.description: 澳大利亚的养老基金正在迅速增加对美国金融界重量级公司的投资，因为对美国4.1万亿澳元（2.7万亿美元）养老基金的争夺正在白热化。【原文：Australia’s pension funds are rapidly boosting their allocations to the heavyweights of US finance as rivalry heats up for access to the country’s A$4.1 trillion ($2.7 trillion) retirement pot.】

item.title: 大多数日本央行观察家预计减少债券购买的步伐将放缓
item.description: 彭博社的一项调查显示，大多数日本央行观察人士预计，在下周的政策会议上，日本央行官员将放慢减少购买政府债券的步伐，并维持利率不变。【原文：A majority of Bank of Japan watchers expect officials to slow their pace of reductions in government bond buying and keep interest rates unchanged at next week’s policy meeting, according to a Bloomberg survey.】

item.title: 亚马逊安全主管敦促对人工智能监管放手一搏
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的首席安全官与其他大型科技公司的官员一道，呼吁减少对人工智能的监管，并警告说，政府介入这一迅速崛起的领域有可能缩小公司的工作范围。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s chief security officer joined officials at other major tech companies in calling for fewer regulations in artificial intelligence, warning that government involvement in this rapidly emerging area risks narrowing the scope of the company’s work.】

item.title: 交易员在 CPI 数据公布前押注 2025 年美联储仅减息一次
item.description: 交易员们越来越多地押注美联储今年只会降息一次，因为有迹象表明，经济增长将保持韧性，通胀将持续走高。【原文：Traders are increasingly betting that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates only once this year amid signs of resilient growth and sticky inflation.】

item.title: 新泽西州运输工程师工会投票支持新工资协议
item.description: 新泽西运输公司的机车工程师们批准了新的工资合同，该合同是在 5 月份为期三天的罢工后达成的协议，罢工导致铁路服务中断。【原文：New Jersey Transit’s locomotive engineers ratified the new wage contract which was the result of an agreement following a three-day strike that halted rail service in May.】

item.title: 阿根廷最高法院禁止基什内尔终身担任公职
item.description: 据当地媒体报道，阿根廷最高法院维持了对前总统克里斯蒂娜-费尔南德斯-德基什内尔的欺诈罪判决，批准判处她六年监禁以及终身禁止担任公职。【原文：Argentina’s Supreme Court upheld former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner’s fraud conviction, ratifying her sentence to six years in prison as well as a lifelong ban on holding public office, according to local media.】

item.title: Ascend 将向高管支付高达 246 万美元的破产奖金
item.description: Ascend Performance Materials 公司是一家破产的工业尼龙生产商，该公司在法院的保护下努力削减债务并进行重组，因此获得了向 11 名高管支付总额高达 246 万美元奖金的许可。【原文：Ascend Performance Materials Inc., a bankrupt maker of industrial nylon, won court permission to pay 11 executives a total of as much $2.46 million in bonuses as the company works to cut debt and reorganize itself while in court protection.】

item.title: 常青住宅公司将为 VineBrook 管理 21,000 套独户住宅出租房
item.description: Evergreen Residential Holdings 正在接管 VineBrook Homes Trust Inc.【原文：Evergreen Residential Holdings is taking over management of 21,000 US rental homes owned by VineBrook Homes Trust Inc., as single-family landlords find new ways to grow at a time when acquisitions are difficult.】

item.title: 护士因薪酬协议举行罢工，加纳努力实现预算目标
item.description: 加纳要求其护士取消罢工，接受明年实施的工资协议，以保护 2025 年预算不出现意外滑坡。【原文：Ghana has asked its nurses to call off a strike and accept the implementation of a wage deal next year as it seeks to protect the 2025 budget from unplanned slippages.】
